articles.author: Barry Svrluga
articles.title: ‘He’s got that farmer’s strength.’ Ben Ogden, and a silver medal long in the making. - The Washington Post
articles.description: The powerful Vermont native becomes the first male American cross-country Olympic medalist since Bill Koch in 1976.
articles.content: CORTINA dAMPEZZO, Italy In the little resort town of Stratton, Vermont, the pine trees are green, the summers are quiet, and the cross-country ski community is tight. Its there that Jessie Diggins, t… [+220 chars]

articles.author: Sarah Ventre
articles.title: These monks' walk for peace captivated Americans. It ends this week - NPR
articles.description: A group of Buddhist monks walked from Fort Worth, Texas, to Washington, D.C., in the name of peace. The 108-day pilgrimage captivated Americans.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON Thousands gathered at Washington National Cathedral on Tuesday to see Buddhist monks who have completed a 108-day, 2,300-mile journey on foot from Texas to the nation's capital.
